Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partly grey-black in section, the exterior is covered with a brown slip and very faint traces of at least nine lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394677) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394677)
